docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration strongly encouraged insurance companies to give Americans more time to sign up for health plans and pay premiums.

headline.main: Health Plans Urged to Extend Enrollment
headline.print_headline: Health Plans Urged to Extend Enrollment

docs.abstract: Obama administration moves to give consumers more time to sign up and pay premiums under Affordable Care Act; strongly encourages insurance companies to let new subscribers go outside their networks of doctors and hospitals and refill prescriptions for drugs not on their lists of approved medications.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration strongly encouraged insurance companies to give Americans more time to sign up for health plans and pay premiums.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The move was a major shift that could have far-reaching implications for industrial farming and human health.

headline.main: F.D.A. Restricts Antibiotics Use for Livestock
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Restricts Antibiotics Use For Livestock

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration establishes major new policy to phase out the indiscriminate use of antibiotics in cows, pigs and chickens raised for meat; experts say practice has endangered human health by fueling the growing epidemic of antibiotic resistance; change will effectively make it illegal for farmers and ranchers to use antibiotics to make animals grow bigger.
docs.snippet: The move was a major shift that could have far-reaching implications for industrial farming and human health.
